title: How does the USB stick work? What happens when I insert it? - Quora

response.answer_text: The USB memory stick is an external storage device which is based on the ROM principle (Read Only Memory).Inside it has a memory chip that stores the information you provide and can hold it intact for about 10 years or so (if kept in normal conditions of temperature and humidity). When you insert it into the USB port the computer feeds an electrical current to the device, brings the electronics to live, then recognizes the stick and (in most cases) automatically installs the required drivers in order for you to access it's contents. That's the simplest way I can put it for you to understand.If you really want to know the utmost inner workings, you'll have to understand electronics first.
